caption.center: STATE OF OREGON, Respondent, v. WILLIAM KIRK McCULLOUGH, Appellant.

hearing_date.center: Submitted on record and briefs November 2, 2001.

opinion.posture: Appeal from Circuit Court, Multnomah County. Dorothy M. Baker, Judge.
opinion.attorneys:
David E. Groom, Oregon Public Defender, and Jennelle Hall, Deputy Public Defender, filed the brief for appellant.
Hardy Myers, Attorney General, Michael D. Reynolds, Solicitor General, and Erika L. Hadlock, Assistant Attorney General, filed the brief for respondent.
opinion.panel: Before HASELTON, Presiding Judge, and LINDER and WOLLHEIM, Judges.
opinion.opinion_text:
Defendant appeals from a judgment finding him in violation of and revoking his probation for manufacturing a controlled substance. ORS475.992(1)(a). Defendant argues, inter alia, that the trial court erred in failing to advise him adequately of the risks and consequences of proceeding pro se at the probation violation hearing. The state confesses error in that regard, and we determine that concession is well-founded.See State v. Meyrick, 313 Or. 125, 133, 831 P.2d 666 (1992); State v.Quintero, 162 Or. App. 674, 675, 986 P.2d 665 (1999).
Reversed and remanded.Page 413
